com.esri.mo2.map.core
Interface Map

All Superinterfaces:
Canvas
All Known Implementing Classes:
Map, Map
public interface Map
extends Canvas

This interface identifies an object as a Map. It's the stateful Map interface where all the map related properties will be maintained by its implementations.

setExtentLimit

public void setExtentLimit(Envelope limit)
change the Map's extent limit. Once you set this property, future drawing of the Map is confined to the specified Envelope, and LayerExtensions associated with Layers in this Map will retrieve data within the confines of this property. You can switch off this behaviour by setting the extent limit property to null. You must redraw the Map to see the change caused by this property.

Parameters:
limit - the new extent limit, or null == do not use an extent limit

getExtentLimit

public Envelope getExtentLimit()
Obtain the Map's current extent limit. If you get null, then this means that the extent limiting behaviour has been switched off - which is the default when the software starts.

Returns:
the extent limit
See Also:
setExtentLimit(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope)

setCoordinateSystem

public void setCoordinateSystem(CoordinateSystem coordSystem)
changes the coordinate system used to display data in this Map.

Typically, calling this method will result in changing the map unit and recalculating the map extent.

In the general case (from changing one coordinate system to another) setCoordinateSystem will try to recalculate the new map extent based upon the transformation implied between the two coordinate systems. But, if either the previous or the new map projection is null, the method cannot do the calculation, and will change the mapextent to being the full extent - to ensure something is shown.

If some particular extent for a new coordinate system is needed, setExtent method should be called after calling setCoordinateSystem method.

Parameters:
coordSystem - the new CoordinateSystem, or null , if no CoordinateSystem

getCoordinateSystem

public CoordinateSystem getCoordinateSystem()
Get the map's coordiante system

Returns:
the coordinate system object

getLayerset

public Layerset getLayerset()
get the Map's Layerset so that you can add/remove/move a Layer

Returns:
the Layerset

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(String layerName)
helper method, returns a reference to a Layer for the given layer name. For convenience, the name of a sub-Layer inside of a GroupLayer can consist of a dot-separated list of names. For instance, if an ImageServerLayer named "MyServer" is present in the Map, and MyServer has a subLayer named "Cities", then the subLayer can be located by calling getLayer("MyServer.Cities"). For now, only one level of Grouplayer is supported. So, you cannot currently locate a subLayer named "GroupLayer.MyServer.Cities".

Parameters:
layerName - the name of the Layer to be obtained
Returns:
the Layer if found, null == not found

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(int index)
helper method, returns a reference to a Layer in the top-level Layerset of this Map, at the given layer index. Only Layers within the Map's Layerset can be found this way - subLayers cannot be found this way.

See Also:
GroupLayer.layerAt(int), getLayer(String)

getLayerCount

public int getLayerCount()
helper method, returns the number of Layers in the top-level Layerset of this Map. Note that this is not the same as all Layers in the Map, since a Layer could be a GroupLayer and contain subLayers.

Returns:
the number of Layers

getLayerNames

public String[] getLayerNames()
helper method, returns the names of all Layers in the top-level Layerset of this Map.

Returns:
an array of of Layer names

getScale

public double getScale()
convenience method for obtaining the current map scale as a ratio of map units / screen units. This is defined to be the Scale property of the PixelToWorldTransform property of this Map. This is not a "true scale" but it is the current scale used for determining scale dependencies.

Returns:
the current map scale

zoom

public void zoom(double factor)
Convenience method to Zoom by a scale factor of factor. If factor > 1 then this is a zoom-in and if factor < 1 then this is a zoom-out

zoomToScale

public void zoomToScale(double scale)
Convenience method to Zoom to the scale where scale is the map units per pixel.

zoomToCartScale

public void zoomToCartScale(long cartScale)
Zoom to the scale where scale is the cartographic scale i,e. "map units per screen unit".

transformPixelToWorld

public Point transformPixelToWorld(int pixelX,
                                   int pixelY)
convenience method for transforming pixel coordinates to world coordinates without having to know about Transform objects. This method accepts integer x and y pixel values and returns the corresponding Point object.

Parameters:
pixelX - the pixel x coordinate
pixelY - the pixel y coordinate
Returns:
the pixel location transformed to a world coordinates Point
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the extent has not yet been set
See Also:
getPixelToWorldTransform()

transformWorldToPixel

                                   double worldY)

Parameters:
worldX - the world x coordinate
worldY - the world y coordinate
Returns:
the world coordinate location transformed to a pixel Point
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the extent has not yet been set

setExtent

public boolean setExtent(Envelope r)
changes the map extent using the specified Envelope.

The coordinates used in Envelope depend upon the current coordinate system.

Specified by:
setExtent in interface Canvas
Parameters:
r - the new mapextent
Returns:
True == the new extent is changed from the previous one, False == otherwise.
See Also:
setCoordinateSystem(com.esri.mo2.cs.geod.CoordinateSystem)
